Node.definition: = direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a particular group or class of either people (as in a clan or tribe) or animals (as in a genus or species) that share common characteristics
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
literally: to make go up; hence: = causative process by which humans offer a burnt offering and cause its smoke to go up

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: to know (someone); hence: = action by which deities single out humans from among their peers for a specific purpose
= a particular group or class of either people (as in a clan or tribe) or animals (as in a genus or species) that share common characteristics

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= action by which deities or humans inflict a penalty on other deities, humans, animals, or objects, usually as retribution for an offence

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= particle marking a proposition as the only condition for another proposition to be true
= set of particles linking two events and denoting that X will not takes place unless Y is true
= action by which two or more parties come together in a certain place for a particular purpose
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression, fearlessness, and respect
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals
literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= a young male lion (אֲרִי) ≈ regarded as fierce and dangerous
= particle marking a proposition as the only condition for another proposition to be true
= set of particles linking two events and denoting that X will not takes place unless Y is true
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control
= generic term for a small bird; ► usually clean and can therefore be eaten
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= action by which humans blow air into a wind instrument and so produce a signal
= a musical instrument ◄ made from a ram's horn; ► sound is produced by blowing into the small end; ► used for giving signals and during festivals and celebrations

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state/process by which humans experience a strong fear, usually accompanied by shaking and trembling

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= set of particles linking two events and denoting that X will not takes place unless Y is true
= causative action by which a deity or human being causes certain information to become available to someone else
= information that is known by humans or deities but kept hidden from others

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression, fearlessness, and respect
= action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= building or part of a building that has been fortified to provide additional security; often connected to the palace
= town; ◄ located in Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) ► one of the fives cities of the Philistines (פְּלֶשֶׁת)
= building or part of a building that has been fortified to provide additional security; often connected to the palace

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)

= district around the town of Samaria; ◄ ranging from valley of Jezreel (יִזְרְעֶאל) in the north to the valley of Aijalon (אַיָּלֹון) in the south, with the Mediterranean and the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) as its respective western and eastern borders; ► after the conquest of the town of Samaria repopulated with people from other nations

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= process by which humans are shaken out of a state of complacency and routine, ◄ as a result of a certain event
= process by which an event happens with great strength or intensity

Node.gloss: to know how|to be skilful at
Node.definition: literally: to know; hence: = state in which humans have the experience, skill, and expertise to carry out a particular activity

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which people accumulate wealth for themselves and store it up in a designated place
= goods obtained from someone else through extortion and aggression
= action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= building or part of a building that has been fortified to provide additional security; often connected to the palace

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: to bring down; = causative action by which humans cause a construction to collapse to be taken apart
literally: strength; hence: = a construction that is strong and able to resist attacks
= action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war
= building or part of a building that has been fortified to provide additional security; often connected to the palace

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression and strength
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= the lower legs of an animal from the knee until the ankle
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option
= part of a larger unit
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= town; ◄ constructed by king Omri (עָמְרִי) ► capital of northern Israelite (יִשְׂרָאֵל) kingdom until it was conquered by Assyrians (אַשּׁוּר) ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom
= one of the sides or corners of an object|= high quality of beauty
= a low platform standing on four legs, a bit longer than the length of a man, and about 70 80 centimeters wide; ► used by people of means to sit or sleep on
meaning unsure; possibly: = part of a bed, possibly the head rest |= town; ◄ in Syria (אֲרָם) ► capital of one of the Aramaean (אֲרָם) kingdoms
= a low platform standing on four legs, a bit longer than the length of a man, and about 70 80 centimeters wide
= action by which a person or deity informs someone with a favorable or unfavorable message about something about to happen
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= action by which deities or humans inflict a penalty on other deities, humans, animals, or objects, usually as retribution for an offence
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which deities or humans inflict a penalty on other deities, humans, animals, or objects, usually as retribution for an offence
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= town and cult centre, also referred to as Beth Aven (בֵּית אָוֶן) or simply Aven (אָוֶן) ◄ territory of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) near the border of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן)
= causative action by which part of an object is violently removed from a larger unit, with the help of a sharp object, so that it falls to the ground
= projection in the form of the horn of an animal; ◄ located at each of the four corners of the altar
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= cold season of the year; also time of plowing; opposite of קַיִץ (קַיִץ) ≈ sometimes associated with hard work

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

= hot season of the year, opposite of חֹרֶף (חֹרֶף) ► time when most crops are harvested and preparations are made for the cold season; ≈ sometimes associated with excessive heat and drought, and also with hard work

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= a hard creamy white substance ◄ made from the tusk of elephants ► and often used to make ornaments and other articles; ≈ regarded as valuable

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
